title: Child Opportunity Index (COI)
description: The goal of the Child Opportunity Index is to measure and compare specific neighborhood-level (census-tract) quality of life indicators that play a significant factor in the healthy development of children. These measures include: safe housing, access to food, quality of schools, parks, and more. The database and interactive map tool enables exploration of the factors that shape education, health, and socioeconomic outcomes, and the drivers of childhood equity at the neighborhood level.
creator: Boston University School of Social Work.
publisher: Website was developed by the Institute for Equity in Child Opportunity & Healthy Development at Boston University School of Social Work.
provider: Healthy Regions & Policies Lab, University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign
subject: Demographics
